abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Project Completion Report
            (PCR) for the Second Technical Assistance Project in the
            Central African Republic. The overall objectives of the
            Second Technical Assistance Project (TA II) were to assist
            the Government: (i) prepare and implement annual recovery
            and development programs in the major productive sectors and
            public finance; and (ii) strengthen its capacity to
            formulate and implement a medium-term development strategy.
            Project components are (i) short term institutional support
            through provision of the service of resident advisers and
            short-term consultants in key government agencies; (ii)
            long-term institution building through-on-the-job and other
            training for national staff. Conclusion and lessons learned
            are the Second Technical Assistance Project provided
            expertise and training which have brought immediate,
            measurable benefits. The results in the key diamonds and
            forestry sectors are particularly valuable to the economy.
            Without the important reforms brought about in debt
            management and the civil service -- reforms which are
            directly attributable to project activities -- and the
            important studies financed, it is unlikely that the
            Government could have successfully pursued its structural
            adjustment program. The cost of the services of the resident
            advisers involved in these activities is more than justified
            by the benefits they helped the Government to obtain.
